fields.description:
Currently, after 5 failed login attempts, the user is presented with a CAPTCHA.
However, the user is still able to continue with the login attempts (as long as the correct CAPTCHA is entered)

It is not possible to set a maximum number of failed password attempts and lock the user out.
We need to allow site-admins the ability to completely lock the account after a number of failed attempts
fields.summary: Option to lock user out after maximum failed password attempts

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Error occurred when log in as user for the second time
h3. Environment
* IE11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log in as any user, switch back
# Log in as another user

h3. Expected Results
Successfully log in as user

h3. Actual Results
Error attached is shown

 !Screen Shot 2016-01-13 at 7.52.03 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Use Chrome/Firefox
Log out and log in again as site-admin
fields.summary: Error when log in as user

fields.description:
Allow administrator to disable the notification sent when administrator logs in as another user.

The message is "_Just letting you know that your Atlassian Cloud administrator, <Admin Name>, has temporary access to your user account. This means they're logged in as you can do things on your behalf. if you're not sure why this is happening, check with your administrator._"
fields.summary: Disable notification when administrator logs in as another user

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It is currently not possible to use the *Create a KB* feature in JIRA Service Desk in one Cloud instance to a different Confluence instance. This is because, impersonation is not allowed in Cloud as per the *Restricted Functions*:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracloud/restricted-functions-in-jira-cloud-737772276.html  

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow impersonation with credentials so that users can create a KB in a different instance.

h3. Workaround 
None at the moment.
fields.summary: Allow impersonation for Create KB feature in JSD from instance A to Confluence instance B

fields.description:
Customer would like to view the Application Access Configuration on the left panel at the User Management page.

Reason behind is, since the introduction of JIRA 7, we introduced Application Access Configuration which is new to most of the customer. If they were more aware of this feature, they might not even requires to get help from support to configure the application access for different applications.
fields.summary: To Make Application Access Configuration more visible

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a user's password has expired and they attempt to login with their email address, they will receive the following error:

'User or password not found'

However, if they use their username, they receive a 'Password has expired' error message. The error messages need to be consistent.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attempt to log in with an account email address after a password expires.
# Attempt to log in with an account username after the password expires.

h3. Expected Results
Both attempts should show that the password has expired.

h3. Actual Results
Logging in using the email address shows that the username or password is incorrect.
 
h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Password Expired Error not shown with email login

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, _Site-admins_ is able to reset user's password from _User Management_ manually and no email is sent to notify the user.

h3. Suggested Resolution

It would be great to have a feature to reset users' password and email them with a new one to login.
fields.summary: Ability to reset password and email them with a new one

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The /apps/{appId}/users rest endpoint retrieves its results using 2 different queries. One for users in groups which have access to the application, and one for users with direct access.

If you have a single user with direct access, then they show up on every page of confluence Application access.

This also means that when you ask for 31 users, you get 32. The javascript is checking for exactly 31 to show pagination, and so it doesnt show it.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 5.9.1-OD-2015.45.1-0006
* Crowd 2.9.0-OD-089


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Must have > 31 users with confluence access
# Create user and grant access to Confluence Via a group
# Add the User to Confluence Global permissions as a single user

h3. Expected Results
User show's up one time in Confluence Application access page
- https://<INSTANCE_NAME>.atlassian.net/admin/apps
- Switch to confluence tab

h3. Actual Results
- From Page 1 pagination is broken and Navigation to page 2 and beyond do not display
- User Shows up on every page of application access for Confluence

h3.Workaround
Manually navigate to Page 2 by adding {{&start-index=31}} to the end of the URL
EXE:
- Page 1 from the Confluence Tab will look like this:
-- {{https://<Instance_NAME>.atlassian.net/admin/apps?appId=application-confluence-be531040-980e-3b9e-85d8-ed3969ae72fa}}
- Update the URL to:
-- {{https://<Instance_NAME>.atlassian.net/admin/apps?appId=application-confluence-be531040-980e-3b9e-85d8-ed3969ae72fa&start-index=31}}

For subsequent pages use {{&start-index=}}
- 31 (Page 2)
- 61 (Page 3)
- 91 (Page 4)
- etc...
fields.summary: User-level permissions break pagination on confluence application access page

fields.description:
Hi, I want to update my email address for the Atlassian Confluence Jira https://jira.atlassian.com/, but on the profile page there is no link pointing to the account management tool.
Regards, Arnold
fields.summary: Want to change the email address for my account

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if the password policy is changed, there's no timestamp anywhere that tell us when this was done

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a way in the Password Policy section to tell us when a policy was changed
fields.summary: As an admin, ability to see the date that the Password Policy was changed

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently the only SSO option is Google Apps

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be convenient to be able to use Office 365 as well.
fields.summary: Provide SSO Integration with Office 365

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
*All Access Level* filter does not include Portal Only users thus misleading users.
If a user is created in Portal Only, when an administrator searches them using the All Access Level filter, the user is not found. But the admin is not able to create a new user using the email address as they already exist.
h3. Suggested Solution
Rename the filter to *All Core Apps Access*
h3. Workaround
Administrator must manually check both All Access Levels and Portal Only access prior to adding a new user.
fields.summary: Rename "All Access Level" filter wording in User Management

fields.description:
We use Cloud JIRA/Confluence so we have default *System Administrator* account in the list of users. 

Problem is it is shown as member of all user-groups and shown to the end users. See screenshots.

*PS:* I cannot tell when it happened but seems from JIRA version 7.0
fields.summary: Do not show predefined System Administrator account in user groups

fields.description:
Since the recent release {{12th October 2015}}, user is seen to be missing the ability to edit user properties and to edit user roles from user management.

Customer use the user properties to trigger some post function on the workflow. 

h3. Expected result

To be able to edit user properties and user roles in the user management menu as per ID-172.

h3. Actual Result

There is no option to edit user properties or user roles anymore.

h3. Workaround
Manually access the Edit User Properties page using the following URL:
https://[instance-name].atlassian.net/secure/admin/user/EditUserProperties.jspa?name=[username]
Manually access the View User Project Roles page using the following URL:
https://[instance-name].atlassian.net/secure/admin/roles/ViewUserProjectRoles.jspa?name=[username]
fields.summary: Bring Back User Properties and User Roles

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On the User Management, Service Desk's Customers (with restricted portal access only) don't appear when no filter is selected, which technically should display all users. They only appear when the '_Restricted portal_' option is selected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the User Management
# In the '_Users_' tab clear all selected filters

h3. Expected Results
Service Desk's Customer should appear alongside JIRA users.

h3. Actual Results
Only JIRA users appear when no filters are applied.
 
h3.Workaround
Select  the '_Restricted portal_' filter.
fields.summary: Service Desk's Customers don't appear when 'All access levels' filter is selected

fields.description:
1. Log in as an admin
2. Impersonate any other user
3. Drop impersonation
4. Press Login As again

Result:
Error message telling be I cannot log in (bad request).

Note:
Seems to work fine on both Chrome and FF, but reproducible on both IE 11 and Edge.

*Workaround*
Either temporarily use a different browser, or you can clear the cookies for your current session and then log back in and repeat the operation
fields.summary: Cannot impersonate same user twice in a row in IE

fields.description:
Steps:

In JIRA v7.0.0-OD-02-243 (on a dev instance)
Navigated as sysadmin to User Management, selected user A
In another tab, navigate to User Management, selected user B
In user A tab, Clicked {{Log in as user}} button. As user A, finished signup and viewed issue.
In user B tab, Clicked {{Log in as user}}

Outcome:
  Got a nonspecific error message (see screenshot)

Expected:
  Ideally replacing my impersonation, or at least an error message indicating the problem
fields.summary: Using log in as user when already logged in as user has poor error display

fields.description:
I have a script that checks for license expiry in my.atlassian.com.
I can see that the evaluation licenses are now included in the normal set of purchased licenses. I would like to have control to remove any evaluation license from this console that I no longer need. Please can you give us this option?
Thanks
Ben
fields.summary: Allow customers to delete/remove expired evaluation licenses

fields.description:
h3. ***Summary***
Users get a 400 when logging in to Cloud instance. ( (i) This happens just after full sync with horde.)
h3. ***Log Error***
{noformat}
2015-05-18 15:21:05.080906500 2015-05-18 15:21:05,079 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.local_Worker-4 ERROR ServiceRunner     [usermanagement.client.impl.JiraUserProvisioningSynchronizer] An error occurred while de-registering app access config
2015-05-18 15:21:05.080909500 com.atlassian.crowd.exception.OperationFailedException: Not Found
2015-05-18 15:21:05.080909500   at com.atlassian.usermanagement.client.rest.JsonRestExecutor$UserManagementMethodExcecutor.throwError(JsonRestExecutor.java:469)
2015-05-18 15:21:05.080910500   at com.atlassian.usermanagement.client.rest.JsonRestExecutor$UserManagementMethodExcecutor.andCheckResponse(JsonRestExecutor.java:412)
2015-05-18 15:21:05.081036500   at com.atlassian.usermanagement.client.impl.JiraUserProvisioningSynchronizer.deRegisterWithUserManagement(JiraUserProvisioningSynchronizer.java:237)
2015-05-18 15:21:05.081037500   at com.atlassian.usermanagement.client.impl.JiraUserProvisioningSynchronizer.synchronizeConfig(JiraUserProvisioningSynchronizer.java:198)

{noformat}
fields.summary: Intermittent 400 error

fields.description:
If a user doesn't remember his password and uses the "Unable to access your account?" link, it is necessary to input your username to reset the password. 

!forgot_password.png|thumbnail!

In the past, it was possible to reset the password by entering your email address as well. 

It would be good to have this feature back.
fields.summary: Ability to reset your password using your email address instead of the username

fields.description:
h3. ***Steps to reproduce***
# Go to an individual user screen that has > 30 groups
# Notice that only the first 30 groups are displayed, and there are no pagination options
fields.summary: Groups for Users With More Than 30 Groups are not Listed

fields.description:
In Cloud, email addresses can be added to the user profile with space characters at the beginning or end.

Outcoming emails are delivered correctly but
# incoming emails are not matched with users and fail to create issues
# application login breaks: [ID-232|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/ID-232]

Space characters should be restricted from email addresses.
fields.summary: User email address is not checked for spaces at start or end.

fields.description:
h3. ***Summary***
Users from both JIRA and Confluence had already logged, but session stills stated as "Never Logged In". 
This affects several views:
# User Management > Application Access (x)
# User Management > Groups (x)

The view is correct in:
# User Management > Users (/)
# User Management > Users > Individual Users (/)

h3. ***Workaround***
As a temporary workaround, you can request for the audit information from support by filing a support ticket at [support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com]
fields.summary: Application Access shows "Never Logged In" for all users

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Users who have had a Name, Username, and/or Email Address change in Google by their GApps Admin, the change is not synced and updated in User Management

h3. Suggested Solution
Name, Username, and Email Address Changes are synced from GApps into User Management
 
h3. Workaround 
- If only a Name Change (ie 'J Smith' to 'J Doe') and not an Email Address Change:
-The User with the name change can update their Profile- After the Name Change has been made in Google, the user will need to logout and back in to see the changes. 

- If the Name Change includes a new Username/Email Address:
-- Disconnect GApps Integration
-- Edit User's Details in User Management with New Name, Username, and Email Address
-- Re-integrate with GApps

- If the Name Change includes a new Username/Email Address and GApps integration CANNOT be disconnected:
-- Create a new GApps account for the user with their New Name, Username, and Email Address
-- User sign-ins with new GApps account and a new JIRA Account is created for them
-- Disable access to the Old JIRA Account to free up licensing
-- Optional: Re-assign issues that the user created with their Old GApps Account to the New
fields.summary: Sync Name Change From GApps into User Management for Cloud

fields.description:
{panel:title=Two-step verification is now available}
*What is two-step verification?*
 Two-step verification secures your Atlassian account by requiring a second login step. That second step helps to keep your account secure, even if your password is compromised.

*How do I enable two-step verification?*
 You can choose to enable two-step verification from your Atlassian account profile at id.atlassian.com. [Read more about enabling two-step verification for your account|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/secure-your-account-with-two-step-verification-939505063.html].

Additionally, the ability to *enforce* two-step verification is available as part of Atlassian Access. [More information about Atlassian Access|https://www.atlassian.com/enterprise/cloud/access]. If you’re an organization administrator looking to enforce two-step verification, [read more about it here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/enforced-two-step-verification-938859738.html].
{panel}
fields.summary: Provide two factor authentication for Cloud

fields.description:
What I experience is the following:
* When an invitation email is opened and used within the initial validity period it works fine.
* When the user was on vacation for example and was not able to use it on time, I resend the invitation. The link contained in this new email doesn't work. I have to delete the account and re-create it.
The work around is simple, but it is a pain to repeat this manual operation on a regular basis.
fields.summary: Resent invitation email link fails

fields.description:
h3. ***Summary***
Full Name is displaying the Username instead of the full name.

h3. ***Steps to Reproduce***
# Create a user
# Add the user in any group
# Click on the Groups to display the members of the group

*Expected:* Full Name is displayed correctly
*Actual Result:* Full Name is displaying the Username data

*Notes*
If you click on Users instead, the full name is displayed correctly.
fields.summary: Full Name in User Management Page displays Username

fields.description: After bulk-creating new users in User Management using Microsoft Edge, some junk characters appear after the "Added" lozenge on the user list. !image2015-7-20 16-46-33.png|thumbnail! Does not affect other browsers. It's coming from this td: {code} added {code} Removing the "aui-lozenge" class makes the junk go away. Doesn't happen with other aui-lozenges in JIRA.
fields.summary: Edge Support - Junk text appears when adding new users in User Management

fields.description:
When an instance has more than 30 users with access to Confluence, but less users with access to JIRA than confluence, the *Application access* session inside *User Management* does not display the paging buttons responsible for allowing administrators to navigate to the rest of the users list.

When the number of users with access to both JIRA and Confluence is greater than 30, the buttons are correctly displayed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# create 31 users
# grant JIRA access to 30 or less
# grant Confluence access to all of them

h3. Expected Behaviour
The 30 first users are listed and paging buttons are displayed under the list

h3. Actual Behaviour
The 30 first users are listed BUT it is NOT possible to navigate to the remaining pages since the paging buttons are not displayed

h2.Workaround:

Navigate to the confluence application access tab and add {{&start-index=30}} to the end of the URL, this will take you to page two and the page navigation will return for subsequent pages but will disappear if returning to page 1

The URL to access page 2 will look like:
{code}
https://<BASE URL>.atlassian.net/admin/apps?appId=application-confluence-<String of numbers unique per instance>&start-index=30
{code}
fields.summary: Application access not considering Confluence users for paging purposes

fields.description:
h2.Summary

The *Last Session* and *Full Name* column is displaying an incorrect value. This affects the user list displayed under *Application Access* and the *Groups* members listing. Do refer to the screenshot of the bug (in a test instance) below.

!Untitled.png|thumbnail!

h2.Steps to Replicate

Compare the *Last Session* and *Full Name* column value in *Users* and the one in *Application Access* or *Groups*

h2.Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: User List under Application Access and Groups is displaying incorrect value

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When granting users access to JIRA Application or when creating a User with JIRA access on Cloud, the following message is shown:
{color:red}"Unable to add access as there are no default groups for JIRA. Please contact support."{color}

The message suggests that there are no groups linked to the "JIRA Users" [Global Permission|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACLOUD/Managing+Global+Permissions] but *jira-users* is linked correctly to that global permission.

*Cause:*
There are no JIRA use groups that do not have Admin permission

*Environment:* JIRA Cloud

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Add jira-users to *JIRA Administrators* Global Permissions
# verify jira-users it is listed in *JIRA Users*
# Create a new user or grant a user Application Access

*Expected Results:* Error explaining that there are no default groups for JIRA, with a link to resolve it.

*Actual Results:* "Unable to add access as there are no default groups for JIRA. Please contact support." message is shown.

*Notes:*
There is no documentation on what 'default groups for JIRA' really is.

*Workaround*
Remove *jira-users* group from the *JIRA Administrators* global permission
fields.summary: "Unable to add access as there are no default groups for JIRA" message does not tell you how to fix it
Unable to update username using JIRA REST API in Cloud

fields.description: Known problem @ID-246 is preventing me adding users to my instance
fields.summary: Cant add users to Jiara or look at user permissions on CLoud

fields.description:
UM is expecting data that UPP is not sending. Impact is that there are a lot of parts of the UM (User Management) that just don't work. They appear as javascript console errors, and some spinners, and some AUI error flags.

*Workaround*

The fix is being deployed to all instances and will be resolved within the next 5 hours. Please log a ticket with https://support.atlassian.com and ask them to deploy the fix if you need it sooner.
fields.summary: User Management links in UI are broken

fields.description: Currently Google Apps users can't have their username changed, but that's the extent of it. Given we pull in the email address and full name from Google as well, and any changes to those items in Cloud will eventually be overwritten from Google Apps, we should just disable those fields in the Edit User screen as well, and point users to Google Apps if they want to change them.
fields.summary: Google Apps users shouldn't be able to have any user details edited other than password

fields.description:
Currently for Cloud instances, it is possible to set the password expiry which is a plus to a lot of organization.

However, at times, user will need to have an account or two in favor of automation accessing from API (scripts, client programs).

It would be great if the user have the option to exclude some users account from password expiry.
fields.summary: Able to Exclude Account from Password Expiry

fields.description:
h3. Summary
From *admin/billing/overview or *admin/users if a user clicks the help menu, it attempts to redirect to a private page that requires login.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.5-OD-07-005

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Cloud (ensure you're not already logged into confluence.atlassian.com), navigate to Site Administration > User Management (or Billing)
!Screen Shot 2015-06-26 at 17.37.15.jpg|thumbnail!
# Click the help menu
!Screen Shot 2015-06-26 at 17.34.26.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
Expectedly you'd be able to load the article immediately, since it's a public article.

h3. Actual Results
I believe that there's some kind of redirect being attempted here, and so you are faced with a login page.
 
h3. Notes
Recently the Atlassian OnDemand articles were locked down to clients instead of just having redirected to the new Cloud system.

h3.Workaround
Visit this URL directly: [Administer your site|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Administer+your+site]
fields.summary: Accessing help from Cloud Site Administration requires login

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update 2021-06-23}
Hi everyone,

Thank you for your patience and continual feedback on this issue.

We wanted to share an update on this ticket for everyone who has been understandably frustrated about the status of this functionality. We hear you. As a team, we discuss this request and how we might be able to address it several times a year. But ultimately, the delay comes down to how complex this problem is and how many teams are involved to get to a working solution.

Thanks to your input though, especially from those who have been involved in our interviews, we’ve been able to break down your requests into areas we can iteratively improve, which in full transparency, is the most effective way for us to resource and tackle this ask.

Here’s what we’re currently working on:
 * An improved account switcher that will allow you to work more seamlessly across your multiple accounts, without having to constantly log out and log back in. We are expecting to start development on this next quarter so keep your eyes peeled.
 Improving the way you clean up and remove duplicate accounts (bulk deactivation).
 * Identifying and improving the workflows that lead to accidental duplicate account creation in the first place.

We understand that for some of you, these changes above still don’t address the core issue - being able to consolidate everything into just one identity. We are actively discussing with all of our product teams what is feasible here. To offer some insight into why this is not an easy problem for us to solve: we need to ensure that all content (comments, pages, issues, links etc.) continue to be valid under the correct owner, permissions appropriately transferred, and privacy and security settings respected.

To be completely transparent, it is unlikely that we will reach a solution where all data in multiple Atlassian accounts across 20+ services can ever be combined, but we absolutely want to make this a better experience for our customers compared to what it is today.

We’ll continue to post updates here on the changes we’re making to improve the experience for everyone with multiple accounts. Thanks again for your patience as we work through this request.
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

When there are several Atlassian accounts, it is not possible to change the email address because both email addresses are in used.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the ability to merge Atlassian accounts.
h3. Why this is important
 * The purpose of Atlassian to allow users to log in to any Atlassian Cloud products with the same email address. However, without merging the accounts, it's still partially met the purpose.
 ** It is not convenient for users to log into different Atlassian Cloud instances with different Atlassian Accounts

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround at the moment to merge data for multiple Atlassian accounts.
 - For Jira, bulk update the Issues' reporter and assignee from a user to another user following our guides at [Editing multiple issues at the same time|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/editing-multiple-issues-at-the-same-time-902498099.html]
 - If you use Trello, you may be able to use the [Board Transfer Tool|https://help.trello.com/article/1104-how-to-transfer-boards-to-a-new-account] to move Boards from one account to another
 - If you also use Bitbucket you will have to contact support.
fields.summary: Ability to merge Atlassian accounts to a single account with secondary emails

fields.description:
We currently are unable to sign in using Google.  We receive the following error:

"Unexpected error in the authentication system."  

This issue started this weekend.
fields.summary: Unexpected error in the authentication system.

fields.description:
I am working in symantec....I signed up in confluence with my user id (vineet_bhatt) and set a password...still it doesn't logs me in...tried restting my password couple of times...still facing the same issue and i am unable to login.

Please, resolve it.

email id : vineet_bhatt@symantec.com

Thanks,
Vineet
fields.summary: unable to login on confluence

fields.description:
If there is a problem accessing resources from CDN the User Management pages will display a loading icon indefinitely rather than displaying the correct content.

This problem is mostly prevalent in China, where some of the CDNs that we use for jQuery/underscorejs/others are blocked by the Great Firewall.

While not strictly a bug in User Management, we should fall back to local resources when we fail to load resources from CDN.

When the developer tools menu is used to identify any errors it seems that a number of resources are returning 404 errors and others are timing out. See attached images for examples of errors.
fields.summary: User Management displays loading icon indefinitely if CDN resources are blocked/unavailable

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The 'Forgot username or password' screen doesn't recognise user accounts based on email address. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In an Atlassian Cloud login page, click the *Unable to access your account?* link;
# In the next screen, when the 'Password' option is selected, enter an email address associated with an existing account in the _Email address / Username_ field;
# click *Email*. 

h3. Expected Results
A password reset email is sent to the user with respective email address.

h3. Actual Results
An error about incorrect username/password is displayed:
{quote}Sorry, we didn't recognize that username and password combination. Please double-check and try again.{quote}

[^Screen Shot 2015-06-02 at 11.02.32.png]
No exceptions are thrown in the Crowd logs.

h3.Workaround
Use the username to retrieve forgotten password.
fields.summary: 'Forgot username or password' Screen Doesn't Recognise User's Email Address

fields.description:
When trying to integrate Atlassian Cloud site with Google Apps, a "Bad Request" error is displayed right after it's accepted the Google Account to give permissions to Atlassian Cloud.

Workaround:

You can login via the normal login form, your password will be different from your Google Apps login, you can use the forgot my password functionality to reset it.

Still under investigation.
fields.summary: Bad Request error when integrating with Google Apps

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user attempts to log in using their email and there is a trailing space at the end of the email, they receive the following message:

{quote}Sorry, we didn't recognize that username and password combination. Please double-check and try again.{quote}

No relevant logs in the logs can be found.

h3. Environment
Cloud (OnDemand)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user account with a valid e-mail address and password (make sure to put a space after the email)
# Try to log in using the email (without the trailing space)
# You will receive the error.
# Now try to log in by adding a space at the end of the email
# You will be able to log in successfully


h3. Expected Results
The user should be able to log in using the email without the trailing space or the application should not consider the trailing space a valid character.

h3. Actual Results
User receives the following message despite the e-mail address being associated with their account.
{noformat}
"Sorry, we didn't recognize that username and password combination."
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
The user can either add a space to the email or an administrator can edit the email for the user and remove the trailing space.
fields.summary: Users Cannot Log In if there is a Trailing Space in User Email
Google Apps Authentication failing for Cloud customers

fields.description:
At the moment, on any Cloud instance, the default login screen shows the message:
*"To request an account, please contact your JIRA administrators."*
even if the instance doesn't have JIRA enabled.

For Confluence Cloud only instances or Bamboo Cloud instances it may be confusing for users.

Users may not necessarily know what JIRA is or that is referring to the Confluence site administrators. This creates confusion and at the moment is not configurable from within the applications.
fields.summary: Cloud Sign in page 'request an account' text always mentions JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user attempts to reset their password and they enter the e-mail address associated with their account, they receive the message "Sorry, we didn't recognize that username and password combination. Please double-check and try again.” This occurs despite the indication in the UI that the field accepts either e-mail address or username while the password radio button is selected.
 
h3. Environment
Cloud (OnDemand)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user account with a valid e-mail address and password
# Logout and login with the new user to confirm the account is functional
# Logout
# Click 'Unable to access account?’
# Select the password radio button
# Enter the e-mail address of the user created previously in the Email address / Username field
# Click E-mail button

h3. Expected Results
The user should be sent an e-mail at the address specified (assuming it is associated with a valid, active user account on the instance) with instructions for resetting their password.

h3. Actual Results
User receives the following message despite the e-mail address being associated with their account.
{noformat}
"Sorry, we didn't recognize that username and password combination."
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
The user can select the e-mail address / username radio button and successfully receive their username. If they plug that into the password reset UI they can reset the password for their account. In certain environments, users are accustomed to logging in exclusively with their e-mail address and may not be aware of what their explicit user name is.
fields.summary: Unable to reset password using e-mail address (must use username)

fields.description:
*Summary*
When a user attempts to reset their password and they enter the e-mail address associated with their account, they receive the message "Sorry, we didn't recognize that username and password combination. Please double-check and try again.” This occurs despite the indication in the UI that the field accepts either e-mail address or username while the password radio button is selected.

*Step to reproduce:*
# Navigate to https://<instance_URL>/login/forgot
# Choose *Password* option
# Fill in the *Email Address / Username* field with a valid email address

*Expected Results*
The user should be sent an e-mail at the address specified (assuming it is associated with a valid, active user account on the instance) with instructions for resetting their password.

*Actual Results*
User receives the following message despite the e-mail address being associated with their account.
"Sorry, we didn't recognize that username and password combination."
- !image002.png|thumbnail!

*Workaround*
Use the 'username' to retrieve the password. If the username is unknown, users can select the "e-mail address / username" radio button and successfully receive their username by entering the email address. They may use the username to retrieve the password after that.

*Notes:*
In certain environments, users are accustomed to logging in exclusively with their e-mail address and may not be aware of what their explicit user name is.

*Affected Version*
- JIRA 6.5-OD-03-002
fields.summary: Error occur when user trying to reset the password using email address

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When logout is completed on Cloud system using French as primary language, the English word for *connection* is used in the translation:

!Confluence-logout-french-err.jpg|thumbnail!


h3. Environment
* Atlassian Cloud Instance

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set French as default browser language.
# Create a test Atlassian Cloud Instance, and login.
# Logout and confirm logout. On final page, it will say "Vous êtes déconnecté de cette instance de Atlassian Cloud." and "Retourner à la page de connection"

h3. Expected Results
Text should be "Retourner à la page de *connexion*"

h3. Actual Results
Text is "Retourner à la page de *connection*"
fields.summary: When logging out of Cloud, French translation for "connection" is misspelled.

fields.description:
The option to configure "Maximum Authentication Attempts Allowed" and show a CAPTCHA on Cloud is no longer managed by JIRA.

Changes are saved when changing the value or clearing it to set "Unlimited" attempts, but it doesn't work and CAPTCHA is still enabled and configured to 6 failed login attempts.

Option available at: {{/secure/admin/ViewApplicationProperties.jspa}}

The option should be hidden and removed from the documentation: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Configuring+JIRA+Options


*Notes:*
Tested in JIRA + Confluence Cloud instance
Same configuration option is shown in Confluence and also doesn't work. [CONF-37435|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-37435]
fields.summary: Maximum Authentication Attempts Allowed doesn't work on Cloud

fields.description: To use <instance>/admin/users/sign-up, the user needs to enter the User Verification code, however Google images cannot be loaded by user located in China.
fields.summary: Users from China cannot see image for User Verification (Captcha)

fields.description:
When I click *Administer User* link on *User Profile* page, I come to the *Users* page.
See screenshot-1.

The same problem when I click my name link on *Edit User Properties* page.
See screenshot-2.

Version Affected is JIRA v6.4-OD-15-055, no in the list.
fields.summary: "Administer User" link moves me to wrong page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The 'Keep Me Signed In' Option Using GAPPS is No Longer Working after closing your browser. A user has to keep logging in everytime a browser is closed even though cookies are not cleared manually. This was working a couple of weeks ago (possibly related to the OAuth2 change).

h3. Environment
* GAPPS enabled

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure Google authentication is enabled in the environment
# Make sure the 'Keep me signed in' option is checked under the Google Apps login section
# Log in using the 'Sign In Using Google' option
# Once logged in, close the browser tab and then close the browser (make sure to quit)
# Reopen browser and navigate to the instance url

h3. Expected Results
A user did not need to log in again when the browser was closed when using the Keep Me signed in option

h3. Actual Results
A user is always prompted to login again when the browser is closed, regardless of time elapsed.
 
h3. Notes
- multiple browsers tested (Chrome V42.0.2311.135, Firefox V37.0.2, IE 10,11)
- It looks like no Persistent cookie is created when signing in with Google like the ondemand.autologin cookie equivalent of Cloud login.

h3.Solution / Workaround
Do not close the browser/log in again
fields.summary: 'Keep Me Signed In' Option Using GAPPS No Longer Working When Browser is Closed

fields.description:
After [Google shut down the APIs|http://googleappsupdates.blogspot.jp/2015/03/final-reminder-deprecated-google-apps.html] that were used for the Atlassian Cloud App, on April 20.[The app is no longer available on Google Apps administration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=732529724].

Customers would like to have this feature back for easier access/administration of the Atlassian Cloud instance.
fields.summary: Enable Atlassian Cloud icon in the Google Apps administration

fields.description:
After upgrading to OAuth 2.0 Google APIs we noticed that the Atlassian Google Marketplace quick link App has disappeared. 

We would need Atlassian to publish a new Google Marketplace application to facilitate users to access the application through the Google Apps menu.
fields.summary: Publish Google Marketplace Application with new OAuth 2.0 APIs

fields.description:
Administrators or Site-Admins should be given the choice to rename their own username.

Workaround
# Create a new user and grant it administrative privileges.
# Log in as the user and change the username of your user.
fields.summary: Renaming own username

fields.description:
h3. Problem & Questions

Users that are removed from application access should up in the Inactive Users filter in User Management. Instead, they show up as Active Users with the option to Deactivate. Not sure if this is intended or unclear wording however it is confusing. 

By clicking the Deactivate link, user shows up in Inactive Users even though nothing has changed. Is the Active Users and Inactive Users using status to determine active/inactive? If so, why doesn't removing application access cause the user to have a status of inactive?

Also, if a user was previously removed from application access by unchecking the boxes then deactivated, why does activating not restore them back the application access?

Is this intended behavior? If so, is there way to bulk edit users instead of clicking "Deactivate" on each individual user. This is extremely tedious if you have 100+ users that have been removed from application access. 

h3. Steps To Recreate
# Create new user and give them application access
# Go to User Management and look up newly created user
# Click on user
# Uncheck boxes for JIRA and Confluence
# Go back to User Management and filter by Inactive Users
# User does not show up as expected
fields.summary: Unchecking boxes for user in application access does not add them to inactive list

fields.description:
A few customers are relating Google Apps authentication stopped working. The error message is the following:
{code}Unexpected error in the authentication system{code}

*Workaround*
*Use the local users created by Gapps*
# Have an administrator log in using the local user
#* Use the Google username
#* Reset the password using the 'Unable to access your account?' option in the login page
#* Use the local signin, not Google login
!local_signin.png|thumbnail!
# Once the administrator has access, (s)he can reset all users password, so they can log in the same way
{noformat}
https://instance.atlassian.net/admin/passwordpolicy
{noformat}
#* An alternative is to have other users reset their password as the admin did
fields.summary: Google apps authentication failing

fields.description:
+To Reproduce+

create a HAL9K instance with a confluence only license
include atlassian.com in the Gapps
allow self sign up in site admin
user attempts to sign up via "sign in using google" button

+Expected Behaviour+
User can sign in as usual

+Actual Behaviour+
"Action not permitted screen"
fields.summary: Action not permitted shown when log in via google

fields.description:
After talking to Atlassian support it appears that there are no requests regarding using outside SSO providers (i.e.: OKTA, Ping Identity, One Login..) with Atlassian ID. 

Is it anywhere on the roadmap to allow the use of existing SSO providers to work with BitBucket by going through Atlassian ID?

It's very possible that Atlassian has already planned of how the thousands of companies that already have an SSO solution are going to use Atlassian Cloud products. I just can't find any information about it.


Our use case:
We would like to begin using BitBucket but don't want to take on the overhead of yet another location to manage users. 

We already have OKTA in use for all our major apps (including on-premise JIRA/Confluence) and have no interest in migrating to Atlassian ID for the sole purpose of being able to use SSO with BitBucket.
fields.summary: External SSO (Single Sign On) integration with Atlassian ID?

fields.description:
h4. Problem
On a Cloud instance, Google apps user was renamed on Gapps, and the email address and display name updated on the instance.
Username does not reflect change, and is not possible to rename due to being Gapps user.

h4.Workaround
Contact Support to change the username.
fields.summary: Cannot change username of a Google apps user

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce: 

1. https://example.atlassian.net/login/forgot
2.  For the question:  Which did you forget? Click the Username radio button. 
3.  No matter what is entered in that field i.e. sdsdsds ... A confirmation message is presented. 

Ideally we would only send an email if its defined in the Cloud instance. Additionally we should have javasript to normalize that data so its a valid email address.
fields.summary: Forgot username or password > invalid emails are allowed

fields.description:
*Summary*
One of customer cloud instance has JIRA DVCS Connector add-on/plugin disabled without performing any action of disabling it. I suspect the add-on/plugin has been disabled during maintennance. This is would cause appearance of this 'Failed to communicate with JIRA regarding Bitbucket access' error message during user creating in JIRA.

*Step to reproduce it:*
# Disable JIRA DVCS Connector Plugin.
# Navigate to User Management.
# Click on 'Create user' button.

*Workaround:*
Enable JIRA DVCS Connector add-on/plugin will remove the error message
fields.summary: Disabling DVCS Connector cause appearance of this error message 'Failed to communicate with JIRA regarding Bitbucket access' during user creation in JIRA

fields.description:
The page [Setting Password Requirements|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Setting+Password+Requirements] needs updates regarding:
- The rules for each password strength.
- Needs to add 'Very Strong' password strength too.
fields.summary: Update Password Requirements Doc

fields.description:
I've asked for my password to be reset and I haven't received anything.

I used https://id.atlassian.com/login/resetpassword
fields.summary: AID doesn't reset my password

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When Cloud received the new User Management, the Group Browser functionality was removed. JIRA Server still has this functionality per [Managing Groups|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Managing+Groups]. This allows features such as showing how certain groups are being used and can be used to avoid problems when renaming groups or modifying permissions.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a similar feature for Cloud User Management to avoid issues when modifying group names or members.
fields.summary: As a Cloud admin, I would like a Group Browser functionality

fields.description:
h4. Problem

Previously, in JIRA User Management, it was possible to view the groups being used and *how* they are being used. This was very useful for customers to determine which groups to keep and which could be removed, for auditing purposes.

The Cloud User Management now no longer has the option described in the [Managing Groups|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Groups] article.

h4. Solution

Provide some way either in JIRA Cloud itself or in User Management along with the Groups page to view which permission schemes or notifications were using said groups.
fields.summary: Unable to view JIRA Group Usage in User Management

fields.description:
h4. Problem
The current reset password dialogue for Cloud says "Unable to access your account?" rather than mentioning this is a way to reset your password. Currently, a few users do not realise this and will resort to asking their admin to reset their password.

h4. Solution
Create a way to show users that this is how they can reset their password, i.e. "Forgot password?"
fields.summary: Re-word "Unable to access your account" Message

fields.description:
h3.Steps to Reproduce:
Browse to User Management and then click on Bulk Create.

h3.Expected Results:
User license number should reflect the correct amount user is subscribed to.

h3.Actual Results:
User license number is showing 2000 which is not the amount user is subscribed to.

!JiraUsers.png|thumbnail!!
fields.summary: JIRA License count displaying incorrectly for Bulk Create

fields.description:
See this screenshot:

!https://s3.amazonaws.com/uploads.hipchat.com/10804/83693/7OkPfgNgtOI6WmD/Screen%20Shot%202015-03-02%20at%2010.47.17%20am.png!
fields.summary: If new GApps enablement required and you click create user then the inline dialog does not disappear.

fields.description:
Currently, site-admin user is unable to remove another Site Admin user from the group. The remove button is greyed out. 

h3. To reproduce:

# Access the instance with a Site-Admin user.
# Create a test user and give a site-admins access to the user.(assign into Site-Admin group)
# From the user page, you will notice the remove group button for *site-admins* is greyed out.

h3. Workaround
Remove the user from the group rather than removing the group from the user.
fields.summary: Site-Admin User cannot remove another Site-Admin user from the group

fields.description:
h4. Problem
When you have 5 users or less, the create user form is inline and does not have all the same options as the form displayed when you have 6 users or more. 

See Screenshots:

h4. Steps To Reproduce
1. Add 6 users

h4. Workaround
If you want the extra options but have less than 6 users go to:
http://<instance-url>/admin/users/add

Tested On:
5.7-OD-42-046
fields.summary: Create new users form varies

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce

This, so far, is affecting Confluence-only Cloud instances.

It's unknown how a user is set to Inactive but it may be a result of a bug or import tasks. To create an inactive user, set a user to inactive in cwd_user table, for example:
{code}update cwd_user set active = 'F' where user_name = 'username_here';{code}

The user will be marked as 'Inactive' in the user management. 

h3. Actual Result

A site-admin has no way to reactivate the user.

h3. Expected Result

A site-admin should be able to reactivate the user.

h3. Workaround

Contact Atlassian Support at https://support.atlassian.com to request for reactivation via database.
fields.summary: Unable to activate Inactive users

fields.description:
{panel:bgcolor=blue}
You can safely ignore this error if users are able to sign in with Google.
{panel}

Cloud customers that have added the "Atlassian OnDemand" OAuth 1.0 marketplace app to their domain still have a link to My Atlassian in their "apps" switcher from google.com sites.

As the new Google Apps integration no longer goes through My Atlassian, the latter it is currently reporting this error even though Google Apps integration is working:

bq. Unfortunately we are unable to locate any active Google Apps enabled hosted instances associated with your domain (xxx.xxx). Please contact us if you do have an active Google Apps enabled hosted instance.

The page needs to be updated to indicate that Google Apps is now managed directly from the instance.
fields.summary: My Atlassian GApps page displays error for users on Directory API
Edit Group > Disable Description Field for Atlassian Service Groups

fields.description:
As a customer, I'd like to have the option to sort based on their last session.

This way, I'll be able to find easily the users that haven't logged in for a long time and manage them accordingly.
fields.summary: Allow user sorting in User Management by their last session

fields.description: Allow customers to resend 'user invitation' emails to customers they've created accounts for in OnDemand in the case where they were not received for whatever reason.
fields.summary: Allow customers to resend 'user invitation' emails to customers they've created accounts for in OnDemand

fields.description:
I am unable to grant users application access to my JIRA instance after I have created them.  I get the error:

There was a problem granting user jermaine access to JIRA. You may wish to try the operation again
fields.summary: Can't grant users access to jira

fields.description: Currently, editing username using JIRA REST API is not supported (only email address and display name are supported). It would be great if this can be implemented
fields.summary: Ability to edit username using JIRA REST API

fields.description:
h3. ***Summary***
It is possible to use a different group to grant the application access for Confluence by removing _confluence-users_ in the Global Permissions and add _access-confluence_ for example. Changing this will cause the Bulk Application Access to fail with no error displayed in the UI.

h3. ***Steps to Reproduce***
# Create a group _access-confluence_
# Grant *Can Use* permission to the group in Global Permissions
# Remove the _confluence-users_ group from Global Permissions
# Go to the *User Management* page > Application Access
# Click on the Confluence tab
# Grant Access by adding users

h3. ***Workaround***
If it is not viable to add confluence-users back in the Confluence Global Permission:
# go to *User Management* page
# click on the group for the application access i.e access-confluence 
# add users to group
fields.summary: Bulk Application Access Fails when the Default Confluence Group is Changed

fields.description:
seraph.rememberme.cookie does not seem to behave properly when using pinned tabs in Chrome.  To reproduce:
1. Log in to Cloud instance using Chrome , and check 'remember me' box.
2. Pin tab
3. Restart browser, or machine.
4. Start chrome browser - you will be asked to login with your credentials again to your Cloud instance.

Tested and confirmed using one, or multiple tabs for one, or multiple Atlasssian applications.
fields.summary: Session remember me cookies not retained after pinning tabs in Chrome and restarting browser.

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce

# In JIRA global permission, grant the jira-users group the JIRA Administrator permission.
# Add JIRA application access to a user

h3. Expected results

JIRA application access is granted to the user.

h3. Actual results

Application access cannot be granted, with the following error:

{panel:bgColor=#f29696}
There was a problem granting user testApp access to JIRA. You may wish to try the operation again.
{panel}
fields.summary: Unable to grant application access due to jira-users group being part of JIRA Administrator global permission

fields.description:
At present, if the person who established the link between Google Apps and Atlassian Cloud has their administrative rights revoked then the link will break. This should not need to be the case as users will leave the company, or role, or may only have temporary rights so that they can establish the link.

This can lead to a confusing situation for many customers when Google Apps just suddenly stops working.

*Workaround*

Follow the guide https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CLOUDKB/Google+Apps+users+experiencing+%27Unexpected+error+in+the+authentication+system%27+when+logging+in for potential workarounds.
fields.summary: "Sign in with Google" stops working when the establisher ceases to have administrative access in Google Apps
Users are not able to connect to GApps

fields.description:
In an effort to reduce friction and deflect common support requests, ideally we can suppress the sysadmin account to avoid confusion. 

Additionally, we should consider suppressing all system accounts, such as add-on accounts, which also cause confusion (i.e. why is it there, is it taking up a license?).

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CLOUDKB/Logging+in+with+the+Systems+Administrator+Account+in+Atlassian+Cloud
fields.summary: Hide sysadmin account

fields.description:
Although another group is configured in Global Permissions, jira-users group doesn't belong to any role or project permission and giving Application Access to users no longer use the jira-users group as a default:
*When trying to delete the jira-users group the following message is displayed:*

"You cannot delete the default users group."

*Cause:*
The jira-users group deletion is prevented from within the code.

*Workaround:*
* remove all users from the group to identify it as a non working group, but the group will remain listed.
fields.summary: jira-users group cannot be deleted on Cloud User Management

fields.description:
Today I tried to login to my ondemand account and got a message "Failure in the Atlassian Cloud authentication system."
Tried resetting my password but can not login to my ondemand account to view and create tickets. This is super important as we input all of our work into this system... business has been halted becouse of this issue...
Please advise
fields.summary: Failure in the Atlassian Cloud authentication system.

fields.description:
The screen located at "Application Access" -> "Grant Access" is no longer granting access.

When submitting the form, nothing seems to happen and looking in the network logs shows the server returning errors.

*Workaround*

Browse to a group that has global permission for the app you want to grant application access to (typically jira-users, confluence-users or bamboo-users) and click 'add'. You can then add users to that group in bulk, and they will be granted access to the application.
fields.summary: Bulk grant access page is not granting access

fields.description:
Current documentation:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Setting+Password+Requirements

However, the information does not provide complete details of how each strength level is determined - only provides examples.

The JIRA password policy documentation for self hosted contains the exact requirements of each level:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Password+Policy+for+JIRA
fields.summary: Provide more complete customer documentation for the Cloud Password Policy.

fields.description:
At this time, if you need to change an email domain for a non Google user, you have to edit them individually

Would be useful to have a way to say, *if the domain is X.com, please change to Y.com*
fields.summary: Ability to Bulk Change Email Domain on Users

fields.description:
Cloud instances that have removed JIRA as a product, disconnected GAPPS, and have become Confluence only instances are unable to change usernames.  See screenshot.

Immediately clicking the edit button in the UM module greets the user with the error message "User is a Google Apps user and cannot be changed", and the username field is greyed out.

Nothing in the confluence, or horde logs.
fields.summary: Unable to change username after disconnecting GAPPS.

fields.description:
h4. Problem:

Currently in the Atlassian Cloud environment users cannot be set to "Inactive" without {{sysadmin}} intervention. Come years end lots of customers request CSV files containing the users and groups in the instance, however, the {{cwd_user}} JIRA table doesn't offer last session data and the *active* column is useless as every user is seen as "Active". 

h4. Suggestion:
Allow admins with access to User Management the ability to set users to "Inactive" so that support may pull current active user data upon request. Feel free to one-up me and add the feature to allow admins to export user data themselves.
fields.summary: Add the ability to set users as Inactive

fields.description:
Example 1 from random cloud instance: 26 groups are displayed on page 1. As a result,  pagination to go to page 2 is presented. However, going to page 2 you find that its the same group from page 1, which is redundant. 

Expectation: page 1 would display 25 groups. Page 2 would display 1 group.

Example 2 from random cloud instance:  
- Page 1 displays 26 groups.  
- Page 2 displays 27 groups (26 plus the last group from page 1)


Expectation: Pages 1 & 2 would display 25 groups

(side note: i haven't tested wether this snowballs - meaning, if there are more than 25 groups on page 3, would it display 28 groups and so forth?)

Could we consider adjusting pagination to occur when there are 25 groups and not display the group at the bottom of page as the first group in the next page?
fields.summary: User Management > Group Pagination not displaying 25 per page

fields.description:
h3.Steps to Reproduce:
# Go to *User Management* (with Mozila Firefox)
# Press *Create User*
# Enter email, username and name
# Create user

h3.Expected Results:
User created.

h3.Actual Results:
User not created and an error is returned. Refer to screenshot.

!atlassian_password.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround:
This bug seems to only affect Mozilla Firefox.  In Chrome; it is working fine. So using other browsers for now will be a suitable workaround.

h3.Notes (Optional):
It seems the current validation is done by checking the password field whether it is empty (and not checking whether the checkbox for email invitation is ticked). The auto-fill feature of Firefox filled in the hidden password field, and it was sent to your server on POST.
fields.summary: Password validation preventing creation of accounts

fields.description:
Currently, when a user has been deactivated in Cloud User Management using the steps [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Deleting+or+Deactivating+Users] they continue to show in the user list along with all other users.  

It would be nice to be able to easily differentiate which users had been deactivated without having to click into users individually or manually rename them.
fields.summary: Differentiate users who have been deactivated in Cloud User Management

fields.description: Allow administrators to customize the email invitations that are sent when a new user is created.
fields.summary: Allow administrators to customize the email invitations that are sent when a new user is created.

fields.description: If the user key in a shorter password (length less than 8) an error is displayed. However this error is rather ambiguous and confuses the customer signing up because instead of showing the real issue (password length less than 8 characters) it shows a generic "An error occurred. Please contact your admin" message.
fields.summary: Better error message for sign up issues

fields.description:
Often users will set up usernames in Atlassian OnDemand to be slightly different to the way they are in Google, but the users will share the same email address. It would be nice if the Google Apps conversion process figured out that the email address matched and gave the option to merge the Google Apps account with the Atlassian OnDemand account.

In some cases, there is also a need to match users who have the exact email address as username. For example, there are some usernames like "user@domain.com" which has to match with Google account "user@domain.com". Currently, OnDemand does not cater for this.
fields.summary: Match users with same email address when integrating Atlassian OnDemand with Google

fields.description:
*scenario*: we have 30 developers on my team that use Google redant.com.au Apps to log in. We also have about 300 customers that have Jira Studio accounts, most of whom also have personal Google accounts

I have yet to hear a customer that is able to log in themselves- any new person always tries to log in via the Google log in. They then get sent to our Google Apps log in page, and try to reset their passwords and get generally confused. I regularly get feedback about how complicated Jira is to use, and then find out it is because they've never actually got past this screen.

I think it is a reasonable assumption that, seeing the Google logo and "log in provider" means you can log in with your Google account. 

*issue:* 
The OnDemand log in page is confusing:
* there is no explanation that by "log in using your google account" means that this will *only* work if you have a redant.com.au google account
* it is not evident that clicking on the OnDemand (\?) icon, there is a separate way of logging in
* there is no help or any kind of assistance on this page. 
* I realise the new Oct release layout looks prettier, but it doesn't address the core issue that for a simple page it is pretty confusing. It has made a confusing page harder to understand

*To fix*
* allow some text on that page that an admin can configure - then we have a chance of explaining
* even better, have some way of setting the default log in provider (or default to OnDemand instead of Google)
fields.summary: Log in page change now even more confusing with new layout
